detaileddescription.para: Connecting to Azure IoT Hub.
Connected to Azure IoT Hub.
Connection attempt failed. The reported error code from the IoT Hub is available in the data.err member in the event structure. The error codes correspond to return codes in MQTT CONNACK messages.
Azure IoT Hub connection established and ready.
Disconnected from Azure IoT Hub.
Device-bound data received from Azure IoT Hub.
Acknowledgment for data sent to Azure IoT Hub.
Device twin has been received.
Device twin has received a desired property update.
Device twin update successful. The request ID and status are contained in the data.result member of the event structure.
Device twin update failed. The request ID and status are contained in the data.result member of the event structure.
Connecting to Device Provisioning Service.
Device Provisioning Service registration has started.
Device Provisioning Service is done, and Azure IoT Hub information obtained.
Device Provisioning Service failed to retrieve information to connect to Azure IoT Hub.

Direct method invoked from the cloud side.
After a direct method has been executed, azure_iot_hub_method_respond must be called to report back the result of the method invocation.
FOTA download starting.
FOTA update done, reboot required to apply update.
FOTA erase pending. On nRF9160-based devices this is typically caused by an active LTE connection preventing erase operation.
FOTA erase done.
FOTA failed
Internal library error

briefdescription.para: Azure IoT Hub notification events used to notify the user.

detaileddescription.para: Data received on the devicebound topic.
Event topic used to send event data to Azure IoT Hub.
Received "desired" properties from the device twin.
Send updates to the "reported" properties in the device twin.
Topic to request to receive the device twin.

briefdescription.para: Azure IoT Hub topic type, used to route messages to the correct destination.
Azure IoT Hub library event handler.

simplesect.para: This API must be called exactly once, and it must return successfully for subsequent calls to this library to succeed.

parameterdescription.para: Pointer to struct containing connection parameters. Can be NULL if embed:rst:inline :kconfig:`CONFIG_AZURE_IOT_HUB_DEVICE_ID` is set.
If successful. Otherwise, a (negative) error code is returned.

briefdescription.para: Establish connection to Azure IoT Hub. The function blocks until a connection to the hub is established on the transport level. Subsequent calls to other library function should await AZURE_IOT_HUB_EVT_CONNECTED and AZURE_IOT_HUB_EVT_READY events.

parameterdescription.para: If successful. Otherwise, a (negative) error code is returned.

briefdescription.para: Disconnect from Azure IoT Hub. Calling this function initiates the disconnection procedure, and the event AZURE_IOT_HUB_EVT_DISCONNECTED is received when it is completed.

parameterdescription.para: If successful. Otherwise, a (negative) error code is returned.

briefdescription.para: Send data to Azure IoT Hub.

parameterdescription.para: Pointer to struct containing data to be transmitted to Azure IoT Hub.
If successful. Otherwise, a (negative) error code is returned.

briefdescription.para: Receive incoming data from Azure IoT Hub.

detaileddescription.para: Implicitly this function calls a non-blocking recv() on the socket with IoT hub connection. It can be polled periodically, but by default this functionality is handled internally in the library.

parameterdescription.para: If successful. Otherwise, a (negative) error code is returned.

briefdescription.para: Ping Azure IoT Hub. Must be called periodically to keep connection alive. By default ping is handled internally in the library.

parameterdescription.para: If successful. Otherwise, a (negative) error code is returned.

briefdescription.para: Send response to a direct method invoked from the cloud.

parameterdescription.para: Structure containing result data from the direct method execution.
If successful. Otherwise, a (negative) error code is returned.

briefdescription.para: Helper function to determine when next ping should be sent in order to keep the connection alive. By default, ping is sent in time automatically by the library.

simplesect.para: Time in milliseconds until next keepalive ping will be sent.
-1 if keepalive messages are not enabled.

briefdescription.para: Reset the stored Azure IoT Hub device provisioning data. This can be used to trigger a new provisioning of the device upon next time the device initiates connection to an IoT Hub.

parameterdescription.para: If successful. Otherwise, a (negative) error code is returned.
